summary: The Permanent Representatives Committee, commonly referred to as Coreper, is a pivotal body within the European Union's institutional framework. It comprises the permanent representatives of EU member states and plays a crucial role in preparing the work of the Council of the European Union. Coreper facilitates negotiations and ensures that legislative proposals are streamlined before they reach the Council for decision-making. This committee is integral to the EU's regulatory processes, as it helps to reconcile national interests with EU objectives, thereby enhancing the efficiency of the legislative procedure. Its function underscores the importance of diplomatic engagement in EU governance.
